thread.title: New York cab turned into Airbnb rental
thread.title_full: New York cab turned into Airbnb rental

title: New York cab turned into Airbnb rental
text:
A TRAVEL agent who has allegedly run into financial difficulties that could see Aussie travellers left thousands of dollars out of pocket, has dealt them a final blow with a Facebook rant. Travel Updates Entrepreneur converts New York City yellow cab into Airbnb rental by: What are these? Cab nap ... The accommodation ranges from converted New York yellow cabs to kitchen-fitted camper vans. Picture: Airbnb/Jonathan Source: Supplied 
AN ENTERPRISING Airbnb user is offering visitors to New York City super cheap accommodation in the form of a fleet of vans he has converted into beds for the night. 
The entrepreneur, whose user name on the site is Jonathan, has parked the vans at strategic locations around the city where guests can access them. Street life ... Another of Jonathan’s vans. Picture: Airbnb/Jonathan Source: Supplied 
They range from converted New York yellow cabs to kitchen-fitted camper vans with the cheapest costing just $29 a night. Some even come with Wi-Fi inside. 
One of the vans, which is parked in Queens just over the river from Manhattan, is carpeted and has a bed in place of the folded-down back seats. Mobile home ... Inside one of the vans. Picture: Airbnb/Jonathan Source: Supplied Car camping ... The converted van has received positive reviews from guests. Picture: Airbnb/Jonathan Source: Supplied 
The converted van has received positive reviews from guests on the apartment-sharing website, with one, David, commenting: “The views from the van were absolutely amazing. The van is parked in a nice area right next to a park and the toilets are literally across the road, although they close at 10pm. The nearest subway station is a 5-10 minute walk away and you’re 1 stop away from Manhattan.” Iconic ... Some of the vans offer views of Manhattan’s famous skyline. Picture: Airbnb/Jonathan Source: Supplied 
Living in your car in New York City is legal although there’s been an attempt to clampdown on Airbnb rentals , pushed in part by New York hoteliers who are losing business to the site. 
The city has targeted several property owners for subletting units on Airbnb. Under city law, renting out apartments for fewer than 30 straight days is illegal.
